explain: Wales' upcoming Euro 2016 qualifier with Belgium at the Cardiff City Stadium on June 12 has been sold out, with both teams having 11 points from their previous five games.

Wales has reached the best position to qualify for a major tournament (World Cup) since 1958, indicating they could potentially advance to a notable competition alongside Belgium for the first time in over half a century.

Gareth Bale's impressive performance in Wales' match against Israel has sparked a massive interest in the Welsh team, with fans and media alike eagerly following their progress towards the Euro 2016 qualifiers.
